meanings.definition: To taste beforehand or in advance.
meanings.sent1: She pretastes the soup to make sure it's seasoned just right.
meanings.sent2: He always pretastes the cake batter before baking it.
meanings.sent3: The chef pretastes the sauce and adds more spices for fun.
meanings.sent4: Before serving, she pretastes the dish to ensure it's perfect.
meanings.sent5: Pretasting the tea, she knew it needed more sugar.

meanings.definition: A taste or flavor experienced before the actual tasting.
meanings.sent1: The pretastes of the soup hinted at a rich, savory flavor.
meanings.sent2: The pretastes of the wine were fruity and refreshing.
meanings.sent3: He enjoyed the pretastes of the ice cream before the main course.
meanings.sent4: The pretastes of the cake were so delicious, he couldn't wait to try more.
meanings.sent5: The pretastes of the dish lingered on her tongue, making her eager for more.
